title: Hiring freeze
description: Order from the mayor's office to submit justification for future hires.

title: New fire chief
description: Lurie names Battalion Chief Dean Crispen as new Fire Chief

title: SF Music week
description: Lurie announces SF Music Week.
sponsor: Daniel Lurie, SF Live, Noise Pop, OEWD

title: New police commissioner
description: Lurie appoints Wilson Leung to the police commission.

title: New health commissioner
description: Lurie appoints Jean Fraser to Prop. E commission.

title: New MTC appointment
description: Lurie appoints Alicia Jean-Baptiste to the MTC.

title: New health commissioners
description: Lurie appoints Tessie Guillermo and reappoints Dr. Laurie Green to the Health Commission.

title: SAFE Streets Act
description: Wiener and Lurie propose state bill that allows local police to enforce fencing operations of suspected stolen goods on Mission Street and the rest of the city.

title: Fentanyl ordinance
description: An ordinance passes the Board of Supervisors to streamline contracting to address drug abuse, homelessness, mental health needs and related crises.
sponsor: Daniel Lurie, Matt Dorsey, Joel Engardio, Stephen Sherrill, Bilal Mahmood, Rafael Mandelman, Danny Sauter

title: Barry Bonds Day
description: Mayor Lurie declares 2/5/25 “Barry Bonds Day”

title: SFPD Hospitality Task Force
description: Lurie launches hospitality task force to centralize police resources around Yerba Buena Gardens, Moscone Center and Union Square.

title: Renewal of two programs aimed at Black students
description: Lurie renews Opportunities for All and Black 2 San Francisco programs.

title: New fire commissioners
description: Lurie appoints Allan Low to the fire commission and reappoints Marcy Fraser.

title: New public health director
description: Lurie makes Daniel Tsai Director of Public Health.

title: Stabilization center
description: Lurie announces plan to open a behavioural health facility at 828 Geary in April

title: Permit reform
description: Lurie announces "PermitSF," plan to reform permitting process by next year

title: SFMTA board appointment
description: Lurie appoints Alfonso Felder to SFMTA Board.

title: Nightlife venues
description: Lurie and Wiener introduce State legislation SB 395 to spur creation of new nightlife venues.

title: New SFMTA director
description: Lurie appoints Julie Kirschbaum as Director of Transportation at the SFMTA.

title: Office to housing conversion
description: Lurie and supes introduce legislation to convert empty offices into housing.
sponsor: Daniel Lurie, Matt Dorsey, Danny Sauter

title: New police commissioner
description: Lurie appoints Mattie Scott to police commission

title: Program to prevent family homelessness
description: Lurie launches $11 million program with Tipping Point to support families with cash and services.

title: First year free
description: Lurie renews first year free program to waive fees and permits for the first year of business

title: Cole Valley Entertainment Zone
description: Lurie celebrates the launch of the new Cole Valley Entertainment Zone, which was created following the mayor's legislation from Febraury 7, 2025.

title: New library commissioners
description: Lurie appoints Dr. Shawn Calhoun and Whitney Jones to join the Library Commission, and reappoints Pete Huang.

title: Reappointment to Human Services Commission
description: Lurie reappoints Dr. James McCray to the Human Services Commission.

title: Waymo airport mapping
description: Lurie gives Waymo the green light to start mapping the roadways at SFO airport.

title: "Breaking the Cycle"
description: Lurie signs executive directive to outline a roadmap with immediate actions and longer-term reforms that will tackle the enduring homelessness and behavioural health crises.

title: Speed cameras
description: Lurie launches San Francisco's automated speed camera enforcement program, with speed cameras to operate at 33 locations in the city.

title: $36M community funding
description: Lurie announces a $36 million funding opportunity through the Human Rights Commission for community-serving organizations.

title: Integrated street teams
description: Lurie announces new street team response model, which consolidates department resources into unified teams assigned to different geographic areas.

title: Police intervention at Van Ness Avenue and Market Street
description: San Francisco Police Department officers engage in a raid at Van Ness Avenue and Market Streets and arrest 40 people. Subsequently, no one was charged.

title: 16th BART Plaza command van
description: San Francisco Police Department mobilizes a command unit at the 16th Street BART plaza.

title: Removal of Max Carter Oberstone from the Police Commission
description: Lurie makes a move to remove Max Carter Oberstone from the Police Commission. Carter-Oberstone was subsequently removed from the body following a 9-2 vote from the Board of Supervisors.

title: Multi-agency raid at Jefferson Square Park
description: The San Francisco Police Department, Sheriff's Department and other agencies raided Jefferson Square Park to crack down on drug activity. Over 80 arrests were made, but according to reporting from the San Francisco Standard, only three were detained on drug dealiong charges.

title: SFPD Sixth Street Triage Center
description: The San Francisco Police Department sets up a triage center on Sixth Street, a one-stop-shop for arrests, drug treatment and homeless busing.
